item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Larry Correia
item.description: "I blame it on Twilight. In real life, vampires only sparkle when they're on fire." -- Larry Correia

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Larry Correia
item.description: "Fish and Wildlife wants to fine us for killing a giant mutant Tennessee River catfish because it was endangered. Sure it had just crawled up on land and eaten some teenagers, but it was still an endangered species." -- Larry Correia

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Kent M. Keith
item.description:
"The Paradoxical Commandments
People are illogical, unreasonable, and self-centered. Love them anyway.
If you do good, people will accuse you of selfish ulterior motives. Do good anyway.
If you are successful, you will win false friends and true enemies. Succeed anyway.
The good you do today will be forgotten tomorrow. Do good anyway.
Honesty and frankness make you vulnerable. Be honest and frank anyway.
The biggest men and women with the biggest ideas can be shot down by the smallest men and women with the smallest minds. Think big anyway.
People favor underdogs but follow only top dogs. Fight for a few underdogs anyway.
What you spend years building may be destroyed overnight. Build anyway.
People really need help but may attack you if you do help them. Help people anyway.
Give the world the best you have and you'll get kicked in the teeth. Give the world the best you have anyway." -- Kent M. Keith

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Reality continues to ruin my life." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "You can be sincere and still be stupid." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Confidence is what you have before you understand the problem." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "God created war so that Americans would learn geography." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Bryan457 add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Build a man a fire, and he'll be warm for a day. Set a man on fire, and he'll be warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett
